docs.title: AntibioticResistanceGeneDetector
docs.text:
Welcome to the documentation for AntibioticResistanceGeneDetector.

A robust Python tool for detecting antibiotic resistance genes in bacterial genomes, supporting BLAST+/DIAMOND, batch and single-file analysis, and rich CLI/visual output.

Current version: {{ version }}

docs.title: Modules
docs.text:
• src.main: CLI entry point
  • src.gene_detector: Gene detection logic
  • src.run_blast: BLAST/DIAMOND/mock wrapper
  • src.interpret_results: Result mapping and reporting
  • src.visualization: Plotting utilities
  • src.rich_utils: Rich console/progress/logging helpers
  • src.utils: Validation, logging, helpers

docs.title: src.main
docs.text:
Main entry point for Antibiotic Resistance Gene Detector.

This module contains the CLI entrypoint that parses arguments and orchestrates the detection pipeline: validation, detection, interpretation, reporting and optional plotting.

docs.title: src.gene_detector
docs.text:
Gene detection helpers.

This module exposes functions to run similarity searches on input FASTA files, extract best hits per gene, and process directories of FASTA files in batch. The functions return normalized hit dictionaries compatible with the interpreter and reporting utilities.

docs.title: src.run_blast
docs.text:
BLAST/DIAMOND wrapper for resistance gene detection.

Provides helpers for invoking DIAMOND or BLAST+ tools (when available) and a lightweight mock search used for testing or when external tools are not present. The module normalizes tabular output into a unified list-of-dicts structure consumed by the rest of the pipeline.

docs.title: src.interpret_results
docs.text:
Interpretation and reporting helpers.

This module maps detected gene identifiers to antibiotic classes using a CSV lookup and provides a small reporting helper that writes CSV output and prints a human-friendly summary table (optionally using Rich).

docs.title: src.visualization
docs.text:
Visualization utilities for AntibioticResistanceGeneDetector.

This module contains helper functions to create common plots used by the project: gene detection heatmaps, per-sample antibiotic-class bar charts, and simple gene→class network diagrams. Plotting uses matplotlib, seaborn and networkx. Functions write image files into the output directory and return nothing (side-effecting helpers).

docs.title: src.utils
docs.text:
Utility helpers for the project: file validation, FASTA parsing, table formatting and logging setup.

The module contains small, focused helpers that are used by the CLI and the detection pipeline. They intentionally avoid heavy dependencies at import time and validate external files robustly.

docs.title: src.error_handling
docs.text:
Error handling utilities for Antibiotic Resistance Gene Detector.

This module provides custom exception types used across the project and a small utility to produce a minimal error report when a sample cannot be processed (for example when a database is missing or corrupted).

docs.title: Classes
docs.text: MissingFileError Raised when an expected file is not found on disk. CorruptedInputError Raised when a FASTA file cannot be parsed or appears corrupted. NoHitsFoundError Raised when no resistance gene hits are found for a sample.

docs.title: Functions
docs.text: safe_fail Write a minimal error CSV and log the error message.

docs.title: src.rich_utils
docs.text: Helpers for optional Rich integration: provides a Console, Progress factory, and Rich logging handler setup. Designed to fall back gracefully when rich is not installed or disabled.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
• Modular Python package
  • CLI entry via src/main.py
  • Core modules: gene detection, BLAST/DIAMOND wrapper, result interpretation, visualization
  • Rich integration for CLI and logging

docs.title: Data Flow
docs.text:
1. Input FASTA(s) validated
  2. BLAST/DIAMOND/mock search
  3. Gene hits mapped to antibiotic classes
  4. Results written to CSV and visualized

docs.title: Flags
docs.text: Flag Description --input Input FASTA file or directory --db Resistance gene DB FASTA --map Gene-to-class CSV mapping file --threads Number of worker threads --outdir Output directory --plot Generate visualizations --summary Print summary table only --quiet Suppress non-error output --rich / --no-rich Enable/disable Rich output --version Print version and exit

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
• Python 3.8+
  • BLAST+ or DIAMOND (optional, for real mode)

docs.title: Install from PyPI
docs.text: pip install arg-res-detector

docs.title: Install from TestPyPI
docs.text: pip install --index-url https://test.pypi.org/simple/ --no-deps arg-res-detector

docs.title: Install from source
docs.text: pip install .

docs.title: Basic CLI Example
docs.text: arg_res_detector --input input/example.fasta --db data/resistance_genes.fasta --map data/gene_class_map.csv

docs.title: Batch Processing
docs.text: arg_res_detector --input input/ --db data/resistance_genes.fasta --map data/gene_class_map.csv --outdir output/

docs.title: Rich Output
docs.text: Rich tables and progress bars are enabled by default. Use --no-rich to disable.
